etymology.description: 全(全) (quán, "whole") refers to something complete or entire, and 素(素) (sù, "plain; vegetarian") originally means simple, plain, or referring to vegetarian food. In this context, 全素 describes a diet that is entirely vegetarian, better known as vegan.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 全(全) (quán, "whole") and 素(素) (sù, "plain; vegetarian") indicates a diet that is entirely plant-based, without any animal products. This reflects the concept of veganism, emphasizing a complete adherence to vegetarian principles.

examples.chinese: 我选择全素(我選擇全素)。
他坚持全素(他堅持全素)，注重环保(注重環保)。
examples.english: He adheres to a vegan lifestyle, emphasizing environmental protection.

examples.chinese: 全素食物营养丰富(全素食物營養豐富)。
